definitions.definition: a large round object in space that moves around a star (such as the sun) and receives light from it

examples.text: the planets of our solar system
the possibility of life deep below the planet's surface
He looked like something from another planet!
How many planets orbit the sun?
Hubble has found around 100 new extrasolar planets.
She believes there is life on other planets.
The spacecraft is currently in orbit around the red planet.
rocky planets like Venus and Mars
the outer planets of our solar system

definitions.definition: used to mean ‘the world’, especially when talking about the environment

examples.text: the battle to save the planet
He must be one of the few people on the planet without a website.
Will recycling help save the planet?
We are destroying the planet with our fossil-fuel lifestyle.
I don't know a single other person on the planet who has seen this film.

definitions.definition: used to suggest that somebody’s ideas are not realistic or practical

examples.text: He thinks being a father is easy. What planet is he on?

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French planete, from late Latin planeta, planetes, from Greek planētēs ‘wanderer, planet’, from planan ‘wander’.
